text.title: LONDON Food Guide | 15 Great Places to Eat!
text.p: [Music]
[Applause]
hello everyone fancy seeing you here and
welcome to the beautiful and exciting
city of London you would have seen it in
your favorite TV shows and movies heard
music produced and recorded here from
some of your favorite artists but of
course we are here for the amazing
London food scene so in today's video we
are going to be showing you everything
we ate in London from British Classics
such as your fish and chips Sunday roast
and the infamous jelly eel to
International favorites such as Indian
food and Chinese food obviously this
video is going to be only covering our
experience in London so it is not a
definitive list but we still hope you
find this video useful and informative
anyway without further Ado are you ready
anby yeah let's get eating around London
let's go let's
[Music]
go
[Music]
now this is how you start your London
trip breakfast is the most important
meal of the day serving it
up an eichi is a more than 100-year-old
London icon that you must experience
especially because of their monstrous
have thee lot full English breakfast
this historic family run institution has
been serving the community not just
delicious food but also a good helping
of the finest family hospitality and
English banter in London
Mom this is the best day their glorious
fry up is an absolute unit that it can
barely fit in the plate it's got the
beans mushrooms Cumberland sausage black
PUD hash browns bacon egg tomatoes and
of course fried bread it's truly an epic
and super comforting meal and remember
iichi is also an Italian restaurant so
we had to get their spaghetti bolines
with a literal mountain of cheese and a
dash of pesto of course and some amazing
toasted garlic chabata with with melty
mozzarella wash everything down with a
coffee and some breakfast tea of course
then you've got yourself a breakfast fit
for a true British
bloke London's black cabs are an iconic
symbol of the city but it's in these
understated yet iconic green Huts that
the cab go for a feed 61 green Huts were
constructed around the late 1800s to
early 1900s but only 13 remain today
serving simple but delicious food only
cabmen are allowed inside but you can
still grab a bite for takeout we got two
sandwiches from their simple and
relatively affordable menu Aliana got a
beautifully stacked sausage bacon and
egg sandwich in between two pillowy
brown Bloomer bread slices while I got a
superlatively stuffed breakfast torpedo
roll which is basically a fry up in a
sandwich with beans sausage bacon egg
and mushroom so messy but oh so good
it's a great and affordable way to start
your morning and bonus points cuz the
cabinet shelter we went to in embankment
place was next to the beautiful White
Hall Garden ens which made for quite the
picturesque breakfast
setting Bagels may be a New York staple
but bagels are a staple of London's east
end this the unmistakable Bagel bake
that's situated in the famous Brick Lane
full of colorful graffiti and eclectic
stores this shop is a fully-fledged
bakery but of course the hunky salt beef
Bagel is the main attraction here juicy
salt beef is thinly sliced before being
served with gerkens and mustard of
course and oh my gosh was the salt beef
super tender and fatty and the bouncy
Bagel complimented it perfectly couldn't
resist getting a few more Bagels such as
this smoked salmon and cream cheese one
of my favorite Bagel Combos and also an
egg and girkin which was pretty decent
too I also mixed it up a bit with a
cheeky sausage roll cuz I am addicted to
that stuff not only are the bagels here
absolutely irresistible but they're also
open 24 hours so you can satisfy your
bagel Cravings anytime of the
day if the bur Market isn't on your
to-do list when you travel to London
then I'm sorry you're the dictionary
definition of a red flag cuz who can
resist this amazing food and produce
market that is one of if not the best
Market in London this Market is not just
full of History dating back to the 12th
century but it's also full of an
impossibly large range of delicious food
to choose from we tried our best to eat
as many Sals as possible starting with
coffee at the Monmouth coffee company
that do an elite flat white and we even
got a cute Canal lit which was great we
also got a super chunky sausage roll
from the ginger Pig butcher cuz I can't
resist one and we also got a scotch egg
which is an egg wrapped in sausage meat
and then breaded which made for quite
the unique bite we also got a colorful
Chan cha from horn okay please which is
a vegetarian Indian food Sal and this
was the bite of color and flavor that I
needed it's a flavorful mix of chickpeas
and a masala sauce to with onion a
Chutney coriander pomegranates and S of
course we are no Stranges to viral Tik
Tok foods and humble crumble have been
making the rounds with their
irresistible crumble selection and
bottomless custard we got a Blackberry
crumble with a crumb brua topped for
some extra sugary sweetness and this was
a heartwarming sweet Tangy and creamy
snack finally before our stomachs
exploded we also got a salt beef and Rye
from Nana Fanny's Deli that used third
generation recipes for their delicious
food this tasty sandwich was filled with
tender salt beef pickles and melty
cheese between Ry
also shout out to the mean flipping
skills from one of the cooks Oh and
before you leave don't forget to grab
some free samples on the way as you
browse through all the beautiful produce
for your next grocery shop what an
amazing
market now this is quintessential
oldtime London grub this is M manzi
Bonzi the oldest existing pie mash and
jelly Deal Store in London these humble
spots have historically been Main Stays
of everyday London dining habits mainly
because of their filling portions and
generally affordable price points it's a
fairly simple menu but good thing their
Humble Pie mesh and liquor is a thing of
comforting Beauty it's a Holy Trinity of
chunky pie filled to the brim with meaty
mints fluffy mashed potatoes slathered
onto the plate and of course the green
parsley liquor and no this liquor does
not in fact contain alcohol my inner
Filipino as well felt a deep connection
to this dish too cuz I love that they
encourage a good dash of vinegar to
liven that dish up
probably
M yeah that's Mt vinegar but of course
you cannot leave without at least trying
their notorious jellied eels it's
basically eels preserved in a stalk
that's set into a jelly it's definitely
nowhere near as repulsive as some people
suggest and just tastes like any other
preserved fish and of course don't
forget to load up on that vinegar wash
it down with a glass of Sara Pilla and
you've got yourself a delicious bite of
London
history you absolutely cannot leave
leave London without eating fish and
chips I mean it's as British as British
food comes we got our Taste Of The Sea
at Master superf fish in South Bank and
with a bold name like that I'm glad
their fish and chips actually hold up to
their bold name I love the local feel of
this place and what's even better is
that they start you off with some
complimentary pickles and even these
tiny prawns that were a great warm-up to
the fish and when the fish arrived good
Lord my face dropped as if I just
discovered El Dorado cuz the food was an
absolute golden f Feast we started with
some delicious tiger prawns which were
nice but the portion was pretty small we
also got Camari which were fried to
Perfection and a spritz of lemon really
enhanced everything and we got two types
of fish and look how massive these
plates are one fish was the Cod and
other was hadock both were pretty great
but the impossibly crispy batter was the
real star of the show an unreal textural
contrast to the juicy and Flaky fish and
of course you can't forget about the
delightful thick cck chips which are
great too don't forget the tomato and
tartar sauce cuz these are the major
keys to success we washed the food down
with a good old London pride and an Old
Speckled Hen and we had ourselves an
epic fish and chips experience in London
well we're missing are some rice cakes
if you know what I mean fish and rice
cake okay I'm going to be honest the
prices for your typical afternoon teas
at five star hotels and department
stores really send my heart into
Financial panic mode but luckily tea and
tattle takes the boxes of not only being
delicious but also being relatively
affordable for an afternoon tea at only
24 lbs per person they have a range of
teas to choose from so I got myself a
soothing CA and AJ got a calming oolong
tea to go with the food and remember
Pinky's up fire like that now that's
fancy I'm joking you don't need to do
that this three tiered Tower comes
stacked with Savory sandwiches at the
bottom some dainty raspberry and
strawberry scones with clotted cream of
course and an assortment of delicious
cakes at the top from Victoria sponges
lemon drizzle Tarts chocolate slices and
my favorite carrot cake not all of us
can shell out for the fancier afternoon
teas but tea and tattle has got your
wallets back cuz who can resist a
delightful afternoon
[Music]
tea bangers and mash is just one of
those classic British Comfort foods that
never fail to satisfy and luckily for us
mother Mash exists cuz it's a place that
specializes in all things bangers and
mash whereas our good friend G Campa
likes to say bang their menu concept is
a mix and match so choose your combo of
Banger mash and gravy I got a classic
and Porky Cumberland sausage with
luscious classic mash and an Umami
traditional gravy dad got a London Smoky
sausage that had Chipotle and hickory
wood smoked pork and his plate came with
cheesy mash and gravy mom got the mother
plucker chicken sausage and she got a
classic bubble-in squeak with onion
gravy and if you're not feeling like
sausages they also do pies so AJ tried
their glor glorious steak and black
heart Stout pie with the classic mash
and parsley liquor combo they also Drew
desserts so we gave into the temptation
of their apple and blackberry crumble
and the iconic sticky date pudding which
both came with pools of custard how
[Music]
good Indian food is so ingrained into
British eating habit so it's no surprise
there are many Indian restaurants in
London with Punjab near seven dials
being the oldest Northern Indian
restaurant in London dating back to 1946
it's a classic spot for Dependable
Punjabi dishes so we had to stick to
some Classics and I guess we also stuck
to Orange cuz look at that glorious
monotonous orange spread you already
know we had to get the butter chicken
it's basic but it's a goodie for a
reason and who doesn't love the iconic
sweet creamy tomatoey and spicious
concoction we also got the signature
orange hued tanduri chicken which came
sizzling on a hot plate and don't forget
to pour yogurt all over your chicken for
a Perfect Touch of freshness of course
we had to get the unofficial national
dish of Britain the chicken Tika Masala
highly addicting Aromas and come on a
little Dippy dip with some garlic naan
you know you got to do it we also got a
delicious veggie Biryani which came with
a veggie Curry and a mango Lassie to
wash it all down this Lassie was thick K
lowy
thick London Chinatown is a sensory
overload of colorful lanterns and
archers mixed with packed streets full
of people all United under one purpose
and it's to eat some amazing Chinese
food we stumbled upon little four
seasons for our first dinner in London
which by the way is the little sibling
to the Four Seasons Restaurant this meal
came at a point in our trip where we
were like we're Asian and need Asian
food and rice right now or we're going
to throw a fit and good Lord my soul was
healed by this meal this place is famous
for their roast Meats so of course we
had to get the Three Musketeers of roast
Meats barbecue pork crispy pork and
roast duck Elite comfort food we also
got some some sliced chicken with black
bean sauce which was so tender and so
delicious we ordered some fried beef hun
for some delicious beefy noodle action
and cuz we're all about balanced diets
stir fried beans with mince porks were
in order too and they were great and yes
we got fried rice too in addition to the
plain rice we already got cuz you
already know rice is life I feel like I
just got possessed we haven't had Asian
food in so long we were just going
like that was so
good
we knew we had to hit up the famous
Mamon dirty ice cream in London cuz
we're all about supporting Filipino
businesses all around the world and I
know what you're thinking no the ice
cream isn't dirty it's just what we call
it in the Philippines they've won a
bunch of awards for their ice cream
which we loved so much that we had to go
twice despite it being so cold in London
we got their calamansi and black bu ice
cream flavors and oh my that kalamansi
made my face pucker up cuz it was so
sour in a good way of course sour the
black bua as well was so creamy and
perfectly coconuty they also do a bunch
of Filipino desserts like their
signature belog which is basically
pandesal filled with a luscious Ube ice
cream as well as a Buco pie which we of
course had to top with cheese ice cream
yes cheese ice cream is an elite flavor
so don't knock it till you try it and to
counteract all the sweets we grabed
their kalamansi aid which again super
sour but really nice to go with the
sweet
dessert
an early flight the next day combined
with some chilly London weather meant
that we were craving for some hearty
Ramen at canadaa and how could we resist
when it was literally just a 2-minute
walk from our hotel this is a famous
Ramen chain that originated in Japan but
now has a few spots all over London we
got two bowls of their Heavenly tonko
Camen and the broth was Ultra Porky
which I guess works out cuz that set us
up for a good night's sleep the noodles
too are also great and the eggs were so
beautifully softboiled and soaked in
delicious marinade agj got a blob of
travel to go with his T kotu and oh my
it made his Ramen Ultra Rich we also got
a couple of onti which made for great
snacks too one was filled with KATU aosi
and another with salmon both excellent
this restaurant is Compact and popular
so do be prepared for a bit of a wait
during peak
[Music]
time okay this is a little bonus place
for you low key Gregs is a must
experience in the UK it's the most
famous bakery chain in the UK and I
couldn't resist getting myself one of
their famous sausage rolls I actually
really loved it but maybe cuz I'm quite
the sausage roll addict in general
either way it's really flaky and the
sausage itself is pretty decent AG got
one of their steak bakes and it was real
good too especially for the price this
is a pretty good spot on the go maybe
next time I'll try one of their vegan
sausage rolls for sure vegan sausage
rolls
[Music]
Sunday Sunday Sunday May mean beers
barbecues and monster truck derbies in
the US OFA but of course in Britain it
can only mean Sunday Sunday roast we may
have experienced one of the ultimate and
jaw-dropping Sunday roast in London at
Blacklock they've got a few locations
around London but we visited the one in
shortage we were on a mission to try out
their Behemoth Allin Sunday roast and my
jaw almost detached itself from my face
when this landed on our table especially
considering we ordered a roast for three
people not four but first a drink for
myself and I got a refreshing cocktail
from their weekly special we also saw
pig face on the menu and immediately had
to get this bad boy on toast don't
forget to pour that gravy too cuz this
was an elite bite anyway their roast
comes with pork lamb and beef all of
which are aged and comes with sauces to
accompany each meat it's got puffy
Yorkshire pudding potatoes all the
trimmings of course and even some
veggies for about bance it's so fun
slowly picking this delicious roast
apart and the best part about this is
their luscious gravy is bottomless so go
crazy cuz this roast is crazy but not as
crazy as loading up your plate at toes
am I right quick stop at toes and load
up that
[Music]
PL and before we end this list we
couldn't leave London without a pint at
a pub so we chose the Salisbury which
was quite close to our hotel every Pub
in London has their own unique Mark in
history and the Salisbury is famous for
not only its drop- dead gorgeous art
noovo Interiors but also for hosting
Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor's
wedding reception for their second
marriage even if we were here just for
one drink we really appreciated the good
old Vibe and history of this
[Music]
PB so yeah get your stomachs ready for
London cuz it's an amazing Treasure
Trove of diverse foods and historical
gems there's truly no place like like it
because there's no place like London yes
and if you want to see more of these
places and our food and travel
adventures in London then be sure to
watch the full Vlogs over on our YouTube
channel anyway that'll do for this video
obviously we couldn't cover the
sprawling London dining scene into one
video but we still hope you found our
insights into these places that we
visited useful regardless London is such
an incredible City to eat your way
through and we had an amazing time
filling our stomachs with some amazing
London food and I'm sure you will too so
thanks for watching bye-bye bye
